decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield multiple times in a single turn. It utilizes spells like Consider, Opt, and Sleight of Hand to dig for more spells while also running cheap spells like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse to trigger the Phoenix's revival ability. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to control the board and buy time for the Phoenix to close out the game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Geier Reach Sanitarium and Waste Not. The win condition is to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Liliana of the Veil, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal. The deck has a strong control aspect with a mix of hand disruption, removal, and card advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and enchanting them to create powerful threats that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ensoul Artifact, Shrapnel Blast, and Spyglass Siren to increase the damage output of the artifacts on the battlefield. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana fixing and a potential late-game threat. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game, utilizing a mix of aggro creatures and burn spells to secure victory.

The main idea of this Rakdos Sacrifice deck is to utilize low-cost creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Mayhem Devil to continuously sacrifice for value, trigger abilities, and deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Claim the Firstborn and Deadly Dispute to steal and sacrifice the opponent's creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional ramp and mana fixing. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive sacrifice strategies to control the board and overwhelm the opponent.
